results.title: Royal tour of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Begins with the Queen landing at Tullamarine Airport and parading through the city in a car. Massive crowds greet her, the city is decorated in red,white and blue in her honour. This is followed by scenes at night with similar, illuminated decorations.

The next day she opens Parliament in the morning, where she gives a speech, before going to the MCG to meet with thousands of ex-servicemen.

On return from Mt. Gambier she visits the Flemington Race Course and Kooyong Tennis Club. A horse race is named in her honour and she congratulates the winning jockey.

At the Shrine of Rememberance, the queen makes a speech and opens the new forecourt.

Meanwhile, the Duke of Wellington inspects a naval base and views a parade.

A garden party is held in honour of the Queen at Government House.

The Queen and Phillip then briefly visit rural Victorian towns on a train.

Phillip is then shown being greeted by ‘wacky’ students at Melbourne University and visiting a science laboratory.

At the MCG, thousands of school students perform dance and gymnastic routines for the Queen.

After travelling to more country towns, where she is greeted by their excited populace, she returns to Melbourne for a final parade in the city.

At Mildura, she is presented with dried fruit and then flies away from Victoria on the Royal plane.

Good titles/’The End’.

results.title: The Argentine ant
results.brief_description: This film describes the methods used by State and Municipal authorities and C.S.I.R.O. to eradicate the Argentine Ant in large suburban and city areas. The efforts of individual householders to eradicate the pest have proved unsuccessful. The film shows, in detail, the large scale methods developed by the C.S.I.R.O. which have been used systematically and methodically in attempting to eradicate the pest.

results.title: 16mm Prints
results.brief_description:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 4)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Several shots of daffodils in a park. Nice colour, long shots.

Section 2. Shots in a park near the Yarra looking towards the city.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

results.title: Flower blooming seed germinating
results.brief_description: Various unedited time-lapse footage. Shows a flower blooming and excellent footage of seeds germinating and plants breaking through soil. Also contains good leader halfway through film. Nice colours, good to watch.

results.title: Planting quarantine bunchy top
results.brief_description: Brief, unedited footage, largely comprised of shots of banana plantations in Queensland. Nice shots of bunchs of bananas being hoisted through the plantations and suntanned men working. Rich colour. Film tin reads ‘Takes 31-32-33-34’.

results.title: Live sheep export to Iran
results.brief_description:
Shows sheep being wormed, branded and fed on a farm before focusing on the modified oil tankers that eventually take them to Iran.

Music throughout is an up-beat synthesised piece with a middle eastern bent.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: A Working holiday
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.

results.title: Phalaris seed retention
results.brief_description:
In order to negate Phelaris crops from losing their ‘top’ before harvesting, crop-dusting is employed.

Features good footage of plane flying over crops and releasing chemicals.

Largely comprises of an interview between a presenter and a scientist.
